title: Joint Rules Resolution - Legislative Process Amendments
description: Joint Rules Resolution - Legislative Process Amendments

history.action: Bill Numbered but not Distributed in Legislative Research and General Counsel
Numbered Bill Publicly Distributed in Legislative Research and General Counsel

general_provisions: This joint rules resolution modifies legislative processes and procedures.
hilighted_provisions: This resolution:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>removes the requirement that the Senate and House Rules committees meet annually to review joint rules;<hr><ltbullet>addresses the process to direct a roll call vote during an electronic meeting;<hr><ltbullet>modifies legislative staff offices' reporting requirement related to performance measures;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Executive Appropriations Committee to meet annually to approve legislative staff offices' budgets and certify the Legislature's budget to the governor;<hr><ltbullet>provides legislators the right to attend appropriations committee meetings, subject to certain restrictions;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies how requests for legislation, priority request designations, and legislation are treated when the chief sponsor is:<hr><ltbullet1>unable to serve in the next annual general session; or<hr><ltbullet1>elected or appointed to serve in the opposite chamber;<hr><ltbullet>addresses the circumstances under which the Office of Legislative Research and General Counsel removes a committee note;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies the order in which the Office of Legislative Research and General Counsel numbers legislation;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies the days of the week the Senate and House give preference for the other chamber's legislation;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits transferring sponsorship on legislation more than once;<hr><ltbullet>modifies the consideration of an amendment or substitute legislation made in the other chamber;<hr><ltbullet>modifies deadlines related to the passage of the final appropriations bill and fiscal note bills;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies reimbursement procedures related to legislative travel;<hr><ltbullet>requires that when a legislative committee creates a subcommittee, the members must include at least one senator and one representative;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes the chairs of the Legislative Process Committee to independently open a committee bill file, subject to certain requirements;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits the chief sponsor of a committee bill from altering the bill before the bill is numbered for introduction, except altering to make a technical correction; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.
